case_vignette: A 26-year-old woman presents to the medicine clinic with swelling around the right side of her chin and neck (Image A). She reports pain when moving her jaw and chewing. Her symptoms developed two days after receiving an uncomplicated tonsillectomy. She has been followed by a general medical physician since birth and has received all of her standard health maintenance procedures. Vital signs are stable with the exception of a temperature of 38.4 degrees Celcius. The area in question on the right side is exquisitely tender. The remainder of his exam is benign.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have swelling around the right side of my chin and neck, and it hurts when I move my jaw or chew.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
These symptoms started two days after I had my tonsils removed.
Have you had any fever or chills since the onset of these symptoms?
Yes, I've had a fever of 38.4 degrees Celsius.
Do you notice any redness in the area of swelling, or is there any pus or discharge?
I didn't mention seeing redness, pus, or discharge in my description.
Have you been taking any antibiotics or other medications after your tonsillectomy?
I didn't mention taking any antibiotics or other medications.
Are there any changes in the taste, or have you noticed any difficulty in opening your mouth fully?
I didn't mention any changes in taste or difficulty in opening my mouth fully.
Is the swelling hard to the touch or does it feel fluid-filled?
The area is exquisitely tender when touched.
Do you have any known allergies or have you experienced any similar conditions in the past?
I didn't mention having any allergies or experiencing similar conditions in the past.
Have you noticed any difficulty in breathing or a change in your voice since the swelling began?
I didn't mention having difficulty in breathing or a change in my voice.
Final Diagnosis: Postoperative infection, likely a post-tonsillectomy abscess.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A patient presents to the clinic with swelling around the right side of their chin and neck, and experiences pain when moving their jaw or chewing. These symptoms began two days after a tonsillectomy. The patient also reports a fever of 38.4 degrees Celsius. There is no mention of redness, pus, or discharge. The area is tender when touched, and the patient has no history of allergies or similar conditions. There is also no difficulty in breathing or changes in voice.
trial_0.vignette_frq: The most likely diagnosis is postoperative lymphadenitis or a localized infection/abscess secondary to the tonsillectomy.
trial_0.multiturn_frq: **Final Diagnosis:** Postoperative infection or hematoma following tonsillectomy.
trial_0.singleturn_frq: **Final Diagnosis:** Parotitis (inflammation of the parotid gland)
